verses.roman:
batriśe chābbiśe mili, aṣṭa-pañcāśa
āra eka bheda śuna arthera prakāśa

synonyms: batriśe—these thirty-two varieties; chābbiśe—the formerly described twenty-six varieties; mili'-added together; aṣṭa-pañcāśa—they become fifty-eight; āra—another; eka—one; bheda—different; śuna—please hear; arthera prakāśa—manifestation of import.
translation: "When we add the twenty-six types of devotees to these thirty-two, they altogether number fifty-eight. You may now hear from Me of manifestations with different meanings.
